1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 public readonly record struct CandleData(DateTime Timestamp, decimal Open, decimal High, decimal Low, decimal Close, long Volume);
7​
8 /// <summary>
9 /// Calculates Bollinger Bands (Middle SMA, Upper Band, Lower Band) based on Standard Deviation.
10 /// </summary>
11 public class BollingerBands
12 {
13 public int Period { get; }
14 public decimal Multiplier { get; }
15 public List<decimal?> UpperBand { get; } = new();
16 public List<decimal?> MiddleBand { get; } = new();
17 public List<decimal?> LowerBand { get; } = new();
18​
19 /// <summary>
20 /// Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="BollingerBands"/> class.
21 /// </summary>
22 /// <param name="period">SMA Period (e.g., 20).</param>
23 /// <param name="multiplier">Standard Deviation Multiplier (e.g., 2.0).</param>
24 public BollingerBands(int period = 20, decimal multiplier = 2.0m)
25 {
26 // Rationale: Standard statistics requirement.
27 if (period <= 0)
28 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period), "Period must be greater than 0");
29 if (multiplier <= 0)
30 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(multiplier), "Multiplier must be greater than 0");
31​
32 Period = period;
33 Multiplier = multiplier;
34 }
35​
36 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
37 {
38 UpperBand.Clear();
39 MiddleBand.Clear();
40 LowerBand.Clear();
41​
42 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
43 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
44​
45 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
46 {
47 // Rationale: Insufficient data to calculate SMA and StdDev.
48 if (i < Period - 1)
49 {
50 UpperBand.Add(null);
51 MiddleBand.Add(null);
52 LowerBand.Add(null);
53 continue;
54 }
55​
56 // Rationale: 1. Calculate SMA (Middle Band)
57 decimal sum = 0;
58 for (int j = i - Period + 1; j <= i; j++)
59 {
60 sum += candleList[j].Close;
61 }
62 decimal sma = sum / Period;
63​
64 // Rationale: 2. Calculate Standard Deviation
65 // StdDev = Sqrt( Variance ), where Variance = Mean of Squared Differences.
66 decimal sumSqDiff = 0;
67 for (int j = i - Period + 1; j <= i; j++)
68 {
69 decimal diff = candleList[j].Close - sma;
70 sumSqDiff += diff * diff;
71 }
72 decimal stdDev = (decimal)Math.Sqrt((double)(sumSqDiff / Period));
73​
74 // Rationale: 3. Calculate Bands
75 // Upper = SMA + (StdDev * K)
76 // Lower = SMA - (StdDev * K)
77 MiddleBand.Add(sma);
78 UpperBand.Add(sma + Multiplier * stdDev);
79 LowerBand.Add(sma - Multiplier * stdDev);
80 }
81 }
82​
83 /// <summary>
84 /// Static convenience method to calculate Bollinger Bands.
85 /// </summary>
86 /// <returns>A tuple containing Upper, Middle, and Lower bands.</returns>
87 public static (List<decimal?> upper, List<decimal?> middle, List<decimal?> lower) Calculate(
88 IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 20, decimal multiplier = 2.0m)
89 {
90 var bb = new BollingerBands(period, multiplier);
91 bb.Calculate(candles);
92 return (bb.UpperBand, bb.MiddleBand, bb.LowerBand);
93 }
94 }
95}

1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (BollingerBands)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// Bollinger Bands (John Bollinger, 1980s) - volatility channel indicator.
6// Three bands that expand/contract based on price volatility.
7//
8// [Core Concepts]
9// 1. Middle Band = SMA(Close, Period) - baseline trend
10// 2. Upper Band = SMA + k × StdDev - resistance zone
11// 3. Lower Band = SMA - k × StdDev - support zone
12// 4. k = multiplier (default 2.0 = ~95% of price action)
13//
14// [Visual]
15// Price
16// │ ╭──────── Upper Band (SMA + k×σ)
17// │ ╱
18// │ │ ←── Price tends to bounce between bands
19// │ │ -------- Middle Band (SMA)
20// │ │
21// │ ╲
22// │ ╰──────── Lower Band (SMA - k×σ)
23// └────────────────────────────────────→ Time
24//
25// =============================================================================
26​
27using System;
28using System.Collections.Generic;
29​
30namespace TechnicalIndicators
31{
32 // =============================================================================
33 // CandleData: OHLCV price container
34 // [Why] Immutable, value-semantic structure for price data
35 // =============================================================================
36 public readonly record struct CandleData(
37 DateTime Timestamp,
38 decimal Open,
39 decimal High,
40 decimal Low,
41 decimal Close,
42 long Volume
43 );
44​
45 // =============================================================================
46 // BollingerBands: Three-band volatility indicator
47 //
48 // [Why] Traders use BB for:
49 // - Volatility measurement (band width)
50 // - Overbought/oversold (price at bands)
51 // - Breakout signals (band expansion)
52 // - Mean reversion (price returns to SMA)
53 //
54 // [What] Outputs: UpperBand, MiddleBand, LowerBand lists
55 // =============================================================================
56 public class BollingerBands
57 {
58 // -------------------------------------------------------------
59 // Properties: Period and Multiplier configure the bands
60 // Default 20/2.0 is John Bollinger's recommendation
61 // -------------------------------------------------------------
62 public int Period { get; }
63 public decimal Multiplier { get; }
64​
65 // -------------------------------------------------------------
66 // Three synchronized output lists (same index = same bar)
67 //
68 // [Visual]
69 // Index: 0 1 2 3 4
70 // Upper: [null, null, 105, 106, 107]
71 // Middle: [null, null, 100, 101, 102]
72 // Lower: [null, null, 95, 96, 97]
73 // └── Period=3: first 2 are null ──┘
74 // -------------------------------------------------------------
75 public List<decimal?> UpperBand { get; } = new();
76 public List<decimal?> MiddleBand { get; } = new();
77 public List<decimal?> LowerBand { get; } = new();
78​
79 // =============================================================
80 // Constructor: Validate and store configuration
81 //
82 // [Why] Fail Fast - reject invalid parameters immediately
83 // Period > 0: Need at least one bar
84 // Multiplier > 0: Negative multiplier would swap bands
85 // =============================================================
86 public BollingerBands(int period = 20, decimal multiplier = 2.0m)
87 {
88 if (period <= 0)
89 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period), "Period must be greater than 0");
90 if (multiplier <= 0)
91 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(multiplier), "Multiplier must be greater than 0");
92​
93 Period = period;
94 Multiplier = multiplier;
95 }
96​
97 // =============================================================
98 // Main Calculation Method
99 //
100 // [How] For each bar with enough data:
101 // 1. Calculate SMA of Close prices (inner loop 1)
102 // 2. Calculate StdDev (inner loop 2)
103 // 3. Derive Upper/Lower from SMA ± k×StdDev
104 //
105 // Time Complexity: O(N × Period)
106 // =============================================================
107 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
108 {
109 // Clear previous results (idempotent)
110 UpperBand.Clear();
111 MiddleBand.Clear();
112 LowerBand.Clear();
113​
114 // Materialize for random access
115 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
116 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
117​
118 // Main calculation loop
119 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
120 {
121 // Warm-up period: not enough data yet
122 if (i < Period - 1)
123 {
124 UpperBand.Add(null);
125 MiddleBand.Add(null);
126 LowerBand.Add(null);
127 continue;
128 }
129​
130 // =======================================================
131 // Step 1: Calculate SMA (Simple Moving Average)
132 // [Why] Middle band is the trend baseline
133 // =======================================================
134 decimal sum = 0;
135 for (int j = i - Period + 1; j <= i; j++)
136 {
137 sum += candleList[j].Close;
138 }
139 decimal sma = sum / Period;
140​
141 // =======================================================
142 // Step 2: Calculate Standard Deviation
143 //
144 // [Visual]
145 // Step 2a: Calculate SMA
146 // [100, 102, 101] → SMA = 101
147 // Step 2b: Calculate Deviations
148 // 100-101=-1, 102-101=+1, 101-101=0
149 // Step 2c: Square Deviations
150 // 1 + 1 + 0 = 2
151 // Step 2d: Variance = 2/3 = 0.667
152 // Step 2e: StdDev = √0.667 ≈ 0.816
153 //
154 // [Why] Population StdDev (divide by N, not N-1)
155 // =======================================================
156 decimal sumSqDiff = 0;
157 for (int j = i - Period + 1; j <= i; j++)
158 {
159 decimal diff = candleList[j].Close - sma;
160 sumSqDiff += diff * diff;
161 }
162
163 // [Note] decimal→double for Math.Sqrt, then back to decimal
164 decimal stdDev = (decimal)Math.Sqrt((double)(sumSqDiff / Period));
165​
166 // =======================================================
167 // Step 3: Calculate and store three bands
168 // Upper = SMA + k×σ (resistance)
169 // Middle = SMA (trend)
170 // Lower = SMA - k×σ (support)
171 // =======================================================
172 MiddleBand.Add(sma);
173 UpperBand.Add(sma + Multiplier * stdDev);
174 LowerBand.Add(sma - Multiplier * stdDev);
175 }
176 }
177​
178 // =============================================================
179 // Static Wrapper: One-liner API returning tuple
180 //
181 // [Why] Convenient for simple use cases
182 // [What] Returns named tuple (upper, middle, lower)
183 // [How] Instantiate → Calculate → Return tuple
184 //
185 // Usage: var (upper, middle, lower) = BollingerBands.Calculate(data);
186 // =============================================================
187 public static (List<decimal?> upper, List<decimal?> middle, List<decimal?> lower) Calculate(
188 IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 20, decimal multiplier = 2.0m)
189 {
190 var bb = new BollingerBands(period, multiplier);
191 bb.Calculate(candles);
192 return (bb.UpperBand, bb.MiddleBand, bb.LowerBand);
193 }
194 }
195}

1import math
2​
3class BollingerBands:
4 """
5 Calculates Bollinger Bands.
6 """
7 def __init__(self, period=20, multiplier=2.0):
8 if period <= 0:
9 raise ValueError("period")
10 if multiplier <= 0:
11 raise ValueError("multiplier")
12 self.period = period
13 self.multiplier = multiplier
14 self.upper_band = []
15 self.middle_band = []
16 self.lower_band = []
17​
18 def calculate(self, candles):
19 self.upper_band.clear()
20 self.middle_band.clear()
21 self.lower_band.clear()
22 if len(candles) == 0:
23 return
24
25 for i in range(len(candles)):
26 # Rationale: Need N samples.
27 if i < self.period - 1:
28 self.upper_band.append(None)
29 self.middle_band.append(None)
30 self.lower_band.append(None)
31 continue
32
33 # Rationale: Compute SMA (Mean).
34 # Slicing: [i - N + 1 : i + 1] gets the window of N items ending at i.
35 window = range(i - self.period + 1, i + 1)
36 s = sum(candles[j]['close'] for j in window)
37 sma = s / self.period
38
39 # Rationale: Compute Variance (Sum of Squared Diffs / N).
40 sum_sq_diff = sum((candles[j]['close'] - sma) ** 2 for j in window)
41 std_dev = math.sqrt(sum_sq_diff / self.period)
42
43 # Rationale: Apply Bands.
44 self.middle_band.append(sma)
45 self.upper_band.append(sma + self.multiplier * std_dev)
46 self.lower_band.append(sma - self.multiplier * std_dev)
47​
48def calculate(candles, period=20, multiplier=2.0):
49 """
50 Static wrapper for Bollinger Bands.
51
52 Returns:
53 Tuple[List, List, List]: (Upper, Middle, Lower)
54 """
55 bb = BollingerBands(period, multiplier)
56 bb.calculate(candles)
57 return bb.upper_band, bb.middle_band, bb.lower_band

1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (BollingerBands)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of
6# Bollinger Bands. We explain *why* code is written this way and
7# *how* data transforms line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
8#
9# [Core Concepts]
10# 1. Statistical Envelope
11# Bollinger Bands create a dynamic envelope around price using
12# statistical measures (SMA and Standard Deviation).
13# Bands expand/contract with volatility.
14#
15# 2. Three Lines
16# - Middle Band: Simple Moving Average of close prices
17# - Upper Band: Middle + (multiplier × StdDev)
18# - Lower Band: Middle - (multiplier × StdDev)
19#
20# 3. Mean Reversion Principle
21# Price tends to return to the mean (middle band).
22# ~95% of price action stays within 2-StdDev bands (normal distribution).
23#
24# [Trading Applications]
25# - Overbought: Price touches upper band
26# - Oversold: Price touches lower band
27# - Breakout: Price closes outside bands with volume
28# - Squeeze: Bands narrow → impending big move
29#
30# =============================================================================
31​
32import math
33​
34​
35# -------------------------------------------------------------
36# Type-Level Explanation: BollingerBands (class)
37#
38# [Why] Encapsulates the calculation of three related outputs.
39# Configurable period and multiplier for flexibility.
40#
41# [What] Computes volatility-based price envelope.
42# Upper, Middle, and Lower bands.
43#
44# [Who] Mean-reversion traders, volatility analysts, option traders.
45#
46# [Where] Heap allocation - stores three output lists.
47# -------------------------------------------------------------
48class BollingerBands:
49​
50 # -------------------------------------------------------------
51 # Constructor: __init__
52 #
53 # [Why] Validate parameters (must be positive for meaningful output).
54 # Standard defaults: period=20, multiplier=2.0.
55 #
56 # [What] period: SMA/StdDev window size
57 # multiplier: StdDev multiplier for band width
58 # -------------------------------------------------------------
59 def __init__(self, period=20, multiplier=2.0):
60​
61 # -------------------------------------------------------------
62 # Logic Step 1: Parameter Validation
63 #
64 # [Decision]
65 # Are period and multiplier valid (> 0)?
66 #
67 # [True Branch: Invalid]
68 # Raise ValueError.
69 #
70 # [False Branch: Valid]
71 # Proceed.
72 # -------------------------------------------------------------
73 if period <= 0:
74 raise ValueError("period")
75 if multiplier <= 0:
76 raise ValueError("multiplier")
77​
78 self.period = period
79 self.multiplier = multiplier
80​
81 # -------------------------------------------------------------
82 # Variable Definition: Band Lists
83 #
84 # [Role]
85 # upper_band: Price + volatility cushion
86 # middle_band: SMA baseline
87 # lower_band: Price - volatility cushion
88 # -------------------------------------------------------------
89 self.upper_band = []
90 self.middle_band = []
91 self.lower_band = []
92​
93​
94 # =============================================================================
95 # IPO: calculate
96 # =============================================================================
97 #
98 # [Input]
99 # - candles: list[dict] - Each dict has 'close' key.
100 #
101 # [Process]
102 # 1. For each bar with sufficient history:
103 # a. Calculate SMA of close prices
104 # b. Calculate population Standard Deviation
105 # c. Derive upper and lower bands
106 #
107 # [Output]
108 # - None (results stored in upper_band, middle_band, lower_band)
109 # =============================================================================
110 def calculate(self, candles):
111​
112 # -------------------------------------------------------------
113 # Logic Step 1: State Reset
114 # -------------------------------------------------------------
115 self.upper_band.clear()
116 self.middle_band.clear()
117 self.lower_band.clear()
118​
119 # -------------------------------------------------------------
120 # Logic Step 2: Empty Input Guard
121 # -------------------------------------------------------------
122 if len(candles) == 0:
123 return
124​
125 # -------------------------------------------------------------
126 # Logic Step 3: Main Calculation Loop
127 #
128 # [Visual]
129 # period = 5
130 # i: 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 ...
131 # Out: None None None None [BB] [BB] [BB]
132 # -------------------------------------------------------------
133 for i in range(len(candles)):
134​
135 # -------------------------------------------------------------
136 # Logic Step 3.1: Insufficient History Check
137 #
138 # [Decision]
139 # Do we have 'period' bars for window?
140 #
141 # [True Branch: Insufficient]
142 # Append None to all bands.
143 #
144 # [False Branch: Calculate]
145 # Proceed to SMA and StdDev.
146 # -------------------------------------------------------------
147 if i < self.period - 1:
148 self.upper_band.append(None)
149 self.middle_band.append(None)
150 self.lower_band.append(None)
151 continue
152​
153 # -------------------------------------------------------------
154 # Logic Step 3.2: Calculate SMA (Middle Band)
155 #
156 # [How] (Logic)
157 # Sum of closes in window / period
158 #
159 # [Visual]
160 # Window: [100, 102, 98, 101, 99]
161 # SMA = 500 / 5 = 100
162 # -------------------------------------------------------------
163 s = sum(candles[j]['close'] for j in range(i - self.period + 1, i + 1))
164 sma = s / self.period
165​
166 # -------------------------------------------------------------
167 # Logic Step 3.3: Calculate Standard Deviation
168 #
169 # [Why] (Intent)
170 # StdDev measures price dispersion around the mean.
171 # Higher StdDev = more volatile = wider bands.
172 #
173 # [How] (Logic)
174 # Population StdDev: sqrt(Σ(x - mean)² / N)
175 #
176 # [Visual]
177 # Prices: [100, 102, 98, 101, 99], SMA = 100
178 # Deviations: [0, 2, -2, 1, -1]
179 # Squared: [0, 4, 4, 1, 1]
180 # Variance = 10/5 = 2
181 # StdDev = √2 ≈ 1.41
182 # -------------------------------------------------------------
183 sum_sq_diff = sum((candles[j]['close'] - sma) ** 2 for j in range(i - self.period + 1, i + 1))
184 std_dev = math.sqrt(sum_sq_diff / self.period)
185​
186 # -------------------------------------------------------------
187 # Logic Step 3.4: Calculate Upper and Lower Bands
188 #
189 # [Why] (Intent)
190 # Bands expand/contract with volatility.
191 # multiplier = 2 captures ~95% of price action (assuming normality).
192 #
193 # [How] (Logic)
194 # Upper = SMA + multiplier × StdDev
195 # Lower = SMA - multiplier × StdDev
196 #
197 # [Visual]
198 # SMA = 100, StdDev = 2, multiplier = 2
199 # Upper = 100 + 4 = 104
200 # Lower = 100 - 4 = 96
201 #
202 # High volatility (StdDev = 5):
203 # Upper = 100 + 10 = 110
204 # Lower = 100 - 10 = 90
205 # (Bands widen!)
206 # -------------------------------------------------------------
207 self.middle_band.append(sma)
208 self.upper_band.append(sma + self.multiplier * std_dev)
209 self.lower_band.append(sma - self.multiplier * std_dev)
210​
211​
212# =============================================================================
213# Static Wrapper Function: calculate
214# =============================================================================
215#
216# [Why]
217# Provides functional API returning all three bands as a tuple.
218#
219# [Pattern: 3-Step Static Wrapper]
220# =============================================================================
221def calculate(candles, period=20, multiplier=2.0):
222 # 1. Instantiation
223 bb = BollingerBands(period, multiplier)
224​
225 # 2. Execution
226 bb.calculate(candles)
227​
228 # 3. Extraction
229 return bb.upper_band, bb.middle_band, bb.lower_band
